basics.name: Joel Curtis Nicolow
basics.label: Graduate Research Assistant
basics.summary: I am a Master’s student at the University of Hawai‘i Manoa where I study Computer Science. I expect to graduate in Spring 2025

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.company: Climate Resilience Collaborative, University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Training and evaluating U-net and other convolution-based image segmentation models in Pytorch and TensorFlow to segment coastal features such as beach area and the land/water interface.
Created an open-source Python Framework named CoastVision which downloads PlanetScope imagery for a given area of interest, then segments the shoreline in each image

work.company: Water Resources Research Center, University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Training and evaluating image classification and regression models with ResNet backbones in Pytorch
Answer phone and email responses to the ITS Help Desk

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure
Webmaster/IT Officer, IEEE Student Branch, UH Manoa, 2012-2013

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
